intro: Humiria oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed humiria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Humiria oblongifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
